reviewText: I liked Trevor Morgan before his child voice changed. He was ok in this movie. However, I do not like to watch him in any new movies like when he never shaves to do a scene. Cut that stubble Trevor Morgan. You look better fully shaved.
Couldn't find it anywhere else to watch it, so I bought it. No regrets. Great to relieve my youth.

The other reviews listed here for this 3-tape boxed set are NOT reviews of the videos listed here. They are for a 1-tape Disney movie of the same name, listed ELSEWHERE. This set consists of 3 documentary films about GENIUSES in history...Leonardo da Vinci, Charles Darwin and Galileo.

I absolutely adore this movie. PERIOD!!!!!!!

AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

I love Disney Channel Original Movies! They are fun for the whole family! This one is about Charlie! He's a genius who's skipped a bunch of grades and has no friends. He gets accepted to colledge at age 13. When there, he meets a girl and developes a crush on her. He enrolls himself in her school and creates a bad boy image to impress her. When she finds out who he really is, she gets upset. Now he has to set things right with her, and help his school win a hockey championship! This movie teaches kids to be themselves! Go rent it today!

When it comes to science theres no problem Charlie Hoyle can't solve. But there are some other things in life even a Genius can't do,and for that Charlie is about to discover a whole new side to himself.
As a kid it was a great movie. As an adult still makes me laugh cant go wrong with Disney classics.
One of my favorite Disney Channel movies growing up. It may be off a little on the science but it really encourages kids to rise to their full potential.
Great movie, just wish it had English subtitles for hearing impaired.
I absolutely loved this movie on Disney Channel.  If this was on DVD, I would buy it in a heartbeat, so please MAKE IT ON DVD.
i love this movie I been looking for this movie on dvd to buy its a great movie

Genius was not what I expected. The story about boy of junior high school age who is a nuclear physicist and goes to college was contrived and grew more unrealistic as the movie progressed. The two leading young actors were appealing, but the story did not move me. There are now three or four movies with the title "Genius." I was looking for the latest, which my wife and I saw in a local movie theater. Don't be fooled by the title.
